en: We already introduced one basic data structure
last episode: Arrays, also called lists or
vectors in some languages.
zh: 我们在上期视频中介绍了『数组』这个基础数据结构，在其它编程语言中也叫 vector 或 list

en: These are a series of values stored in memory.
zh: 它是在内存中的一组数据

en: So instead of just a single value being saved
into a variable, like j=5, we can define a whole series
of numbers, and save that into an array variable.
zh: 我们可以定义一组数字，并保存在数组变量里。而不是像 j=5 这样每个变量只能存一个值

en: To be able to find a particular value in this
array, we have to specify an index.
zh: 我们通过数组下标找到数组中的某个值

en: Almost all programing languages start arrays
at index 0, and use a square bracket syntax to
denote array access.
zh: 几乎所有语言都从 0 开始计算下标，并且用方括号访问数组

en: It’s easy to confuse the fifth number in
the array with the number at index 5.
zh: 很容易把数组中的第五个值当成是下标为 5 的那个值

en: They are not the same.
Remember, the number at index 5 is the 6th
number in the array because the first number
is at index 0.
zh: 要记住，下标为 5 的是第六个值，因为 0 是第一个值

en: Arrays are extremely versatile data structures,
used all the time, and so there are many functions
that can handle them to do useful things.
zh: 数组是非常实用的数据结构，几乎任何时候都能用到，它有很多函数可以帮我们实现很有用的功能

en: For example, pretty much every programming
language comes with a built-in sort function,
where you just pass in your array, and it
comes back sorted.
zh: 例如，几乎每个编程语言都有内置的排序函数，只需要传入一个数组，它就能给你返回排序后的数组

en: So there’s no need to write that algorithm
from scratch.
zh: 不需要我们自己每次都从头开始写排序算法

en: Very closely related are Strings, which are
just arrays of characters, like letters, numbers,
punctuation and other written symbols.
zh: 字符串跟数组非常像，它是由字符组成的数组，例如字母、数字、连字符还有其他符号
